Our van and the @littlemenherion Workshop. Built for scratch by Huw and a Bernice, complete with solar array and climbing wall (work in progress) We are currently living here, volunteering 3 days a week and running our own small business part time. On a personal journey to learn through doing. Exploring everything that comes with running a smallholding, with the aim of sharing what we learn in our next print journal. Living on the land, building and growing. Harvesting natural energy and being environmentally conscious where possible.  This is an extension of #vanlife but also a huge part alternative living in its own right.  If you are looking to do something similar the woofing & 'Workaway' networks are a great place to start!! #alternativeliving #therollinghome #therollinghomejournal

Awesome building conversion from Daniel @greatredinventor 😉😍 it is rare that I'm speechless 😶 but here the idea and the realization is so breathtaking 😲 love the idea and you should visit his profile for a lot more to see / like and follow him 👌 made with green stuff, Tyranids bits 😉

So an update on O'ot for #wipwednesday he still has a way to go, but you begin to get the general idea.

#IDAHOBIT2017 #LGBT
.
Today is International Day Against Homophobia, Transphobia and Biphobia.
.
Did you know that it happens on May 17 every year to mark the anniversary of of homosexuality no longer being classified as a mental disease by the World Health Organisation, in 1990. Just 27 years ago.
.
Did you know however that, 72 countries still have laws criminalising homosexuality? 37% of these countries are UN member states.
.
Did you know that in some countries, same-sex intercourse is still punishable by death, with Sudan, Iran, Saudi Arabia and Yemen actually implementing it.
.
Did you know that only 0.06% of the world's population live in a country where people are protected from homophobic hate speech?
.
Did you know that marriage is now open for same-sex couples in 21 countries? The Netherlands, Belgium, Spain, Canada, South Africa, Norway, Sweden, Portugal, Iceland, Argentina, Denmark, Brazil, France, Uruguay, New Zealand, the U.K. (exc. N. Ireland), Luxembourg, the US, Ireland, Colombia and now Finland.
.
International rights for LGBT people is still something that needs fighting for. Just because the Western situation may appear a "done deal" for many people, it isn't and the rest of the world still needs to see serious development. It has to stay on the agenda everywhere for that to happen.
.
If you don't understand why, just have a Google of the current situation in Chechnya. Chechnya has been accused of "gay genocide" yet claim that it's impossible, because they state that gay people don't exist in their country. Yet, reports claim that gay people or those perceived as gay are being tortured in detention centres.
.
The official chilling line from their government's spokesmen: "you can't detain and repress people who simply don't exist in the republic"
.
Just because it isn't happening on in your road, doesn't mean it isn't happening. It also doesn't mean it couldn't happen closer to home in the future. People need to challenge their own stereotypes and nurture a culture of acceptance and openness. It isn't "political correctness" to just love and accept others for who they are and for the good that they bring to the world.
.

The liner SS Roma, shown at top in civilian service, was completed in 1926. Flash forward to 1951 and the same hull sits at La Spezia just prior to scrapping. Converted to the roughly 90% complete aircraft carrier Aquila of the Regia Marina, very little resemblance to her original form remains. The fineness of her bow form is probably the most distinct holdover, and the taper up to her cutaway stern is also still somewhat evident, although Aquila was lengthened and had her stern significantly altered. The hangar deck occupies what used to be Roma's main deck.
--
There were other Axis attempts to create a carrier force. In 1942 when Graf Zeppelin's construction resumed, Germany planned to create auxiliary carriers out of existing ships; this included converting the incomplete Admiral Hipper-class cruiser Seydlitz. Renamed Wesen and intended to carry 20 aircraft, the project only succeeded in razing her upper decks before work was halted. She was scuttled in January 1945 and later raised by the Soviets, then scrapped.
--
Another Axis carrier project was the Italian conversion of SS Roma's sister liner, the Augustus. The last post of this series will cover that project tomorrow.
-
#continetalcarriers #aquila #wesen #seydlitz #roma
